tool_description: Get every earthquake and any other event that registers on the richter scale ever catalogued by the USGS, with very detailed location data.
title: EveryEarthquake

api_list.name: Recent Earthquakes
api_list.description: Get the 100 most recent earthquakes from all over in the world, from now to the date and time determined by the 'interval' property.

required_parameters.name: interval
required_parameters.description: Get recent earthquakes from current time, back to a time based on the interval provided. Interval is an ISO8601 Duration, examples: P5D for the last 5 days, PT12H for the last 12 hours. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description:
Add to any call to limit the number of earthquakes returned.
100 earthquakes are returned by default, up to 1000 earthquakes can be returned using the 'count' parameter.

optional_parameters.name: radius
optional_parameters.description:
The length across half a circle of the search area. The latitude and longitude together make up the center of the circle, while the radius is the distance from the center to the outside of the circle. A 10 mile radius will be a circle 20 miles across with its center at the latitude/longitude point.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

optional_parameters.name: units
optional_parameters.description:
Either miles or kilometers for the radius of the search circle.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

optional_parameters.name: intensity
optional_parameters.description: Intensity can be added to limit results to only those earthquakes with at least the specified intensity or greater.

optional_parameters.name: magnitude
optional_parameters.description: Magnitude can be added to limit results to only those earthquakes with at least the specified magnitude or greater.

optional_parameters.name: longitude
optional_parameters.description:
The longitude portion of the point at the center of the search circle.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

optional_parameters.name: start
optional_parameters.description:
Use the 'start' parameter to retrieve more than 1000 earthquakes, up to 1000 at a time. 'Start' is the offset to start at within the overall results.
100 earthquakes are returned by default, up to 1000 earthquakes can be returned using the 'count' parameter.

optional_parameters.name: latitude
optional_parameters.description:
The latitude portion of the point at the center of the search circle.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

optional_parameters.name: type
optional_parameters.description: Type can be added to limit results to only those types specified, e.g.: earthquakes, quarry blasts, explosions. Use the 'types' endpoints to see all available types.

locationDetails.name: North America
locationDetails.description: continent on the Earth's northwestern quadrant

locationDetails.name: contiguous United States
locationDetails.description: 48 states of the United States apart from Alaska and Hawaii
postal code

locationDetails.name: United States of America
locationDetails.description: country in North America

locationDetails.name: California
locationDetails.description: state of the United States of America

locationDetails.name: San Bernardino County
locationDetails.description: county in California, United States

locationDetails.name: Rialto
locationDetails.description: city in California, United States of America

api_list.name: M1.0+ Earthquakes, Past Day
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://everyearthquake.p.rapidapi.com/1.0_day.json"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "everyearthquake.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: API Test
api_list.description: Simple call to determine if the API is available and responding.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://everyearthquake.p.rapidapi.com/testPass"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "everyearthquake.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Earthquakes By Date
api_list.description: Get the 100 most recent earthquakes from all over in the world, within a specified date range.

required_parameters.name: startDate
required_parameters.description: The start date for the search period in YYYY-MM-DD format. All dates start and end at midnight UTC.

required_parameters.name: endDate
required_parameters.description: The end date for the search period in YYYY-MM-DD format. All dates start and end at midnight UTC.

optional_parameters.name: intensity
optional_parameters.description: Intensity can be added to limit results to only those earthquakes with at least the specified intensity or greater.

optional_parameters.name: longitude
optional_parameters.description:
The longitude portion of the point at the center of the search circle.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

optional_parameters.name: type
optional_parameters.description: Type can be added to limit results to only those types specified, e.g.: earthquakes, quarry blasts, explosions. Use the 'types' endpoints to see all available types.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description:
Add to any call to limit the number of earthquakes returned.
100 earthquakes are returned by default, up to 1000 earthquakes can be returned using the 'count' parameter.

optional_parameters.name: latitude
optional_parameters.description:
The latitude portion of the point at the center of the search circle.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

optional_parameters.name: units
optional_parameters.description:
Either miles or kilometers for the radius of the search circle.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

optional_parameters.name: start
optional_parameters.description:
Use the 'start' parameter to retrieve more than 1000 earthquakes, up to 1000 at a time. 'Start' is the offset to start at within the overall results.
100 earthquakes are returned by default, up to 1000 earthquakes can be returned using the 'count' parameter.

optional_parameters.name: radius
optional_parameters.description:
The length across half a circle of the search area. The latitude and longitude together make up the center of the circle, while the radius is the distance from the center to the outside of the circle. A 10 mile radius will be a circle 20 miles across with its center at the latitude/longitude point.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

optional_parameters.name: magnitude
optional_parameters.description: Magnitude can be added to limit results to only those earthquakes with at least the specified magnitude or greater.

api_list.name: Types
api_list.description: Return all types of events ever recorded by the USGS, such as earthquakes, explosions, landslides and many more.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://everyearthquake.p.rapidapi.com/types"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "everyearthquake.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Earthquakes
api_list.description: Get the 100 most recent earthquakes from all over in the world. No parameters required.

optional_parameters.name: units
optional_parameters.description:
Either miles or kilometers for the radius of the search circle.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

optional_parameters.description:
The latitude portion of the point at the center of the search circle.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

optional_parameters.name: magnitude

optional_parameters.name: radius
optional_parameters.description:
The length across half a circle of the search area. The latitude and longitude together make up the center of the circle, while the radius is the distance from the center to the outside of the circle. A 10 mile radius will be a circle 20 miles across with its center at the latitude/longitude point.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description:
Add to any call to limit the number of earthquakes returned.
100 earthquakes are returned by default, up to 1000 earthquakes can be returned using the 'count' parameter.

optional_parameters.name: longitude

The longitude portion of the point at the center of the search circle.

optional_parameters.name: start

Use the 'start' parameter to retrieve more than 1000 earthquakes, up to 1000 at a time. 'Start' is the offset to start at within the overall results.
100 earthquakes are returned by default, up to 1000 earthquakes can be returned using the 'count' parameter.

api_list.name: Latest Earthquake Near Me
api_list.description: Call this endpoint with your latitude and longitude and you'll receive a simple return for the most recent earthquake, within 100 miles, of the lat/long coordinates provided.
